page.title: 18Colvend: Religion
page.content: The joint Parish of Colvend and Southwick was formed by King James VI in 1612 and covers about 40 square miles. Until the Reformation (i.e.about 1565) an ancient church at Colvend had been associated with the Nunnery at Lincluden in Dumfries.It was pulled down in 1771 and another church built on the same spot. The present church, built immediately north of the old one, was completed in 1910. While the new church was being built the congregation met for public worship in Colvend School. The form of worship is Presbyterian and Colvend Church is part of the Church of Scotland. The nearest Roman Catholic Church is in Dalbeattie where there is also a Scottish Episcopal Church. Several smaller sects meet in Dalbeattie or Castle Douglas.
